Line 45: Line 45:
*The 1985 film ''Brazil'' by Terry Gilliam has a reference toward the end of the story.
*The 1985 film ''Brazil'' by Terry Gilliam has a reference toward the end of the story.
â
*The 1985 cult horror film, ''[[Re-Animator]]'', loosely based on an [[H. P. Lovecraft]] story, contains an instance of "reverse necrophilia" when a decapitated surgeon is brought back to life and then sets about kidnapping and sexually molesting the nubile young daughter of the Dean of the Miskatonic medical school. The absurdity culminates in an ingeniously off-color slapstick-surreal [[double entendre]]: the treacherous zombie surgeon attempts to perform [[cunnilingus]] on the now stripped, physically trussed to a table and spread-eagled daughter (i.e., the head literally "gives head").
+
*The 1985 cult horror film, ''[[Re-Animator]]'', loosely based on an [[H. P. Lovecraft]] story, contains an memorable instance of "reverse necrophilia". In the film, a decapitated surgeon is brought back to life and then sets about kidnapping and sexually molesting the nubile young daughter of the Dean of the Miskatonic medical school. The absurdity culminates in an ingeniously off-color slapstick-surreal [[double entendre]]: the "re-animated" surgeon holds his severed head out and attempts to perform [[cunnilingus]] on the now stripped, physically trussed to a table and spread-eagled daughter (i.e., the head literally "gives head").
*The 1987 [[controversial]] [[Germany | German]] film ''[[Nekromantik]]'' offers a graphic portrayal of [[Paraphilia|sexual]] necrophilia.
*The 1987 [[controversial]] [[Germany | German]] film ''[[Nekromantik]]'' offers a graphic portrayal of [[Paraphilia|sexual]] necrophilia.
